3082    /**
3083     * Calculates the space required for the domain axis/axes.
3084     *
3085     * @param g2  the graphics device.
3086     * @param plotArea  the plot area.
3087     * @param space  a carrier for the result ({@code null} permitted).
3088     *
3089     * @return The required space.
3090     */
3091    protected AxisSpace calculateDomainAxisSpace(Graphics2D g2,
3092            Rectangle2D plotArea, AxisSpace space) {
3093
3094        if (space == null) {
3095            space = new AxisSpace();
3096        }
3097
3098        // reserve some space for the domain axis...
3099        if (this.fixedDomainAxisSpace != null) {
3100            if (this.orientation.isHorizontal()) {
3101                space.ensureAtLeast(
3102                    this.fixedDomainAxisSpace.getLeft(), RectangleEdge.LEFT);
3103                space.ensureAtLeast(this.fixedDomainAxisSpace.getRight(),
3104                        RectangleEdge.RIGHT);
3105            } else if (this.orientation.isVertical()) {
3106                space.ensureAtLeast(this.fixedDomainAxisSpace.getTop(),
3107                        RectangleEdge.TOP);
3108                space.ensureAtLeast(this.fixedDomainAxisSpace.getBottom(),
3109                        RectangleEdge.BOTTOM);
3110            }
3111        }
3112        else {
3113            // reserve space for the primary domain axis...
3114            RectangleEdge domainEdge = Plot.resolveDomainAxisLocation(
3115                    getDomainAxisLocation(), this.orientation);
3116            if (this.drawSharedDomainAxis) {
3117                space = getDomainAxis().reserveSpace(g2, this, plotArea,
3118                        domainEdge, space);
3119            }
3120
3121            // reserve space for any domain axes...
3122            for (CategoryAxis xAxis : this.domainAxes.values()) {
3123                if (xAxis != null) {
3124                    int i = getDomainAxisIndex(xAxis);
3125                    RectangleEdge edge = getDomainAxisEdge(i);
3126                    space = xAxis.reserveSpace(g2, this, plotArea, edge, space);
3127                }
3128            }
3129        }
3130
3131        return space;
3132
3133    }
3134
3135    /**
3136     * Calculates the space required for the range axis/axes.
3137     *
3138     * @param g2  the graphics device.
3139     * @param plotArea  the plot area.
3140     * @param space  a carrier for the result ({@code null} permitted).
3141     *
3142     * @return The required space.
3143     */
3144    protected AxisSpace calculateRangeAxisSpace(Graphics2D g2,
3145            Rectangle2D plotArea, AxisSpace space) {
3146
3147        if (space == null) {
3148            space = new AxisSpace();
3149        }
3150
3151        // reserve some space for the range axis...
3152        if (this.fixedRangeAxisSpace != null) {
3153            if (this.orientation.isHorizontal()) {
3154                space.ensureAtLeast(this.fixedRangeAxisSpace.getTop(),
3155                        RectangleEdge.TOP);
3156                space.ensureAtLeast(this.fixedRangeAxisSpace.getBottom(),
3157                        RectangleEdge.BOTTOM);
3158            } else if (this.orientation == PlotOrientation.VERTICAL) {
3159                space.ensureAtLeast(this.fixedRangeAxisSpace.getLeft(),
3160                        RectangleEdge.LEFT);
3161                space.ensureAtLeast(this.fixedRangeAxisSpace.getRight(),
3162                        RectangleEdge.RIGHT);
3163            }
3164        } else {
3165            // reserve space for the range axes (if any)...
3166            for (ValueAxis yAxis : this.rangeAxes.values()) {
3167                if (yAxis != null) {
3168                    int i = findRangeAxisIndex(yAxis);
3169                    RectangleEdge edge = getRangeAxisEdge(i);
3170                    space = yAxis.reserveSpace(g2, this, plotArea, edge, space);
3171                }
3172            }
3173        }
3174        return space;
3175
3176    }
3177
3178    /**
3179     * Trims a rectangle to integer coordinates.
3180     *
3181     * @param rect  the incoming rectangle.
3182     *
3183     * @return A rectangle with integer coordinates.
3184     */
3185    private Rectangle integerise(Rectangle2D rect) {
3186        int x0 = (int) Math.ceil(rect.getMinX());
3187        int y0 = (int) Math.ceil(rect.getMinY());
3188        int x1 = (int) Math.floor(rect.getMaxX());
3189        int y1 = (int) Math.floor(rect.getMaxY());
3190        return new Rectangle(x0, y0, (x1 - x0), (y1 - y0));
3191    }
3192
3193    /**
3194     * Calculates the space required for the axes.
3195     *
3196     * @param g2  the graphics device.
3197     * @param plotArea  the plot area.
3198     *
3199     * @return The space required for the axes.
3200     */
3201    protected AxisSpace calculateAxisSpace(Graphics2D g2, 
3202            Rectangle2D plotArea) {
3203        AxisSpace space = new AxisSpace();
3204        space = calculateRangeAxisSpace(g2, plotArea, space);
3205        space = calculateDomainAxisSpace(g2, plotArea, space);
3206        return space;
3207    }
3208
3209    /**
3210     * Receives a chart element visitor.  Many plot subclasses will override
3211     * this method to handle their subcomponents.
3212     * 
3213     * @param visitor  the visitor ({@code null} not permitted).
3214     */
3215    @Override
3216    public void receive(ChartElementVisitor visitor) {
3217        // visit the domain axes
3218        for (Entry<Integer, CategoryAxis> entry : this.domainAxes.entrySet()) {
3219            if (entry.getValue() != null) {
3220                entry.getValue().receive(visitor);
3221            }
3222        }
3223        // visit the range axes
3224        for (Entry<Integer, ValueAxis> entry : this.rangeAxes.entrySet()) {
3225            if (entry.getValue() != null) {
3226                entry.getValue().receive(visitor);
3227            }
3228        }
3229        // visit the renderers
3230        for (Entry<Integer, CategoryItemRenderer> entry : this.renderers.entrySet()) {
3231            if (entry.getValue() != null) {
3232                entry.getValue().receive(visitor);
3233            }            
3234        }
3235        // and finally this plot
3236        visitor.visit(this);
3237    }
3238
3239    /**
3240     * Draws the plot on a Java 2D graphics device (such as the screen or a
3241     * printer).
3242     * <P>
3243     * At your option, you may supply an instance of {@link PlotRenderingInfo}.
3244     * If you do, it will be populated with information about the drawing,
3245     * including various plot dimensions and tooltip info.
3246     *
3247     * @param g2  the graphics device.
3248     * @param area  the area within which the plot (including axes) should
3249     *              be drawn.
3250     * @param anchor  the anchor point ({@code null} permitted).
3251     * @param parentState  the state from the parent plot, if there is one.
3252     * @param state  collects info as the chart is drawn (possibly
3253     *               {@code null}).
3254     */
3255    @Override
3256    public void draw(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D area, Point2D anchor,
3257            PlotState parentState, PlotRenderingInfo state) {
3258
3259        // if the plot area is too small, just return...
3260        boolean b1 = (area.getWidth() <= MINIMUM_WIDTH_TO_DRAW);
3261        boolean b2 = (area.getHeight() <= MINIMUM_HEIGHT_TO_DRAW);
3262        if (b1 || b2) {
3263            return;
3264        }
3265
3266        // record the plot area...
3267        if (state == null) {
3268            // if the incoming state is null, no information will be passed
3269            // back to the caller - but we create a temporary state to record
3270            // the plot area, since that is used later by the axes
3271            state = new PlotRenderingInfo(null);
3272        }
3273        state.setPlotArea(area);
3274
3275        // adjust the drawing area for the plot insets (if any)...
3276        RectangleInsets insets = getInsets();
3277        insets.trim(area);
3278
3279        // calculate the data area...
3280        AxisSpace space = calculateAxisSpace(g2, area);
3281        Rectangle2D dataArea = space.shrink(area, null);
3282        this.axisOffset.trim(dataArea);
3283        dataArea = integerise(dataArea);
3284        if (dataArea.isEmpty()) {
3285            return;
3286        }
3287        state.setDataArea(dataArea);
3288        createAndAddEntity((Rectangle2D) dataArea.clone(), state, null, null);
3289
3290        // if there is a renderer, it draws the background, otherwise use the
3291        // default background...
3292        if (getRenderer() != null) {
3293            getRenderer().drawBackground(g2, this, dataArea);
3294        } else {
3295            drawBackground(g2, dataArea);
3296        }
3297
3298        Map<Axis, AxisState> axisStateMap = drawAxes(g2, area, dataArea, state);
3299
3300        // the anchor point is typically the point where the mouse last
3301        // clicked - the crosshairs will be driven off this point...
3302        if (anchor != null && !dataArea.contains(anchor)) {
3303            anchor = ShapeUtils.getPointInRectangle(anchor.getX(),
3304                    anchor.getY(), dataArea);
3305        }
3306        CategoryCrosshairState<R, C> crosshairState = new CategoryCrosshairState<>();
3307        crosshairState.setCrosshairDistance(Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY);
3308        crosshairState.setAnchor(anchor);
3309
3310        // specify the anchor X and Y coordinates in Java2D space, for the
3311        // cases where these are not updated during rendering (i.e. no lock
3312        // on data)
3313        crosshairState.setAnchorX(Double.NaN);
3314        crosshairState.setAnchorY(Double.NaN);
3315        anchor_extract(anchor, dataArea, crosshairState);
3316        crosshairState.setRowKey(getDomainCrosshairRowKey());
3317        crosshairState.setColumnKey(getDomainCrosshairColumnKey());
3318        crosshairState.setCrosshairY(getRangeCrosshairValue());
3319
3320        // don't let anyone draw outside the data area
3321        Shape savedClip = g2.getClip();
3322        g2.clip(dataArea);
3323
3324        drawDomainGridlines(g2, dataArea);
3325
3326        AxisState rangeAxisState = axisStateMap.get(getRangeAxis());
3327        chechaxis_extract(g2, parentState, dataArea, rangeAxisState);
3328
3329        Graphics2D savedG2 = g2;
3330        BufferedImage dataImage = null;
3331        boolean suppressShadow = Boolean.TRUE.equals(g2.getRenderingHint(
3332                JFreeChart.KEY_SUPPRESS_SHADOW_GENERATION));
3333        if (this.shadowGenerator != null && !suppressShadow) {
3334            dataImage = new BufferedImage((int) dataArea.getWidth(),
3335                    (int)dataArea.getHeight(), BufferedImage.TYPE_INT_ARGB);
3336            g2 = dataImage.createGraphics();
3337            g2.translate(-dataArea.getX(), -dataArea.getY());
3338            g2.setRenderingHints(savedG2.getRenderingHints());
3339        }
3340
3341        // draw the markers...
3342        iterate_renderer_extract(g2, dataArea);
3343
3344        // now render data items...
3345        boolean foundData = false;
3346
3347        // set up the alpha-transparency...
3348        Composite originalComposite = g2.getComposite();
3349        g2.setComposite(AlphaComposite.getInstance(
3350                AlphaComposite.SRC_OVER, getForegroundAlpha()));
3351
3352        DatasetRenderingOrder order = getDatasetRenderingOrder();
3353        List<Integer> datasetIndices = getDatasetIndices(order);
3354        for (int i : datasetIndices) {
3355            foundData = render(g2, dataArea, i, state, crosshairState)
3356                    || foundData;
3357        }
3358
3359        // draw the foreground markers...
3360        List<Integer> rendererIndices = getRendererIndices(order);
3361        iteraterendererindexes_extract(g2, dataArea, rendererIndices);
3362
3363        // draw the annotations (if any)...
3364        drawAnnotations(g2, dataArea);
3365
3366        if (this.shadowGenerator != null && !suppressShadow) {
3367            BufferedImage shadowImage = this.shadowGenerator.createDropShadow(
3368                    dataImage);
3369            g2 = savedG2;
3370            g2.drawImage(shadowImage, (int) dataArea.getX()
3371                    + this.shadowGenerator.calculateOffsetX(),
3372                    (int) dataArea.getY()
3373                    + this.shadowGenerator.calculateOffsetY(), null);
3374            g2.drawImage(dataImage, (int) dataArea.getX(),
3375                    (int) dataArea.getY(), null);
3376        }
3377        g2.setClip(savedClip);
3378        g2.setComposite(originalComposite);
3379
3380        if (!foundData) {
3381            drawNoDataMessage(g2, dataArea);
3382        }
3383
3384        int datasetIndex = crosshairState.getDatasetIndex();
3385        setCrosshairDatasetIndex(datasetIndex, false);
3386
3387        // draw domain crosshair if required...
3388        R rowKey = crosshairState.getRowKey();
3389        C columnKey = crosshairState.getColumnKey();
3390        setDomainCrosshairRowKey(rowKey, false);
3391        setDomainCrosshairColumnKey(columnKey, false);
3392        if (isDomainCrosshairVisible() && columnKey != null) {
3393            Paint paint = getDomainCrosshairPaint();
3394            Stroke stroke = getDomainCrosshairStroke();
3395            drawDomainCrosshair(g2, dataArea, this.orientation,
3396                    datasetIndex, rowKey, columnKey, stroke, paint);
3397        }
3398
3399        // draw range crosshair if required...
3400        ValueAxis yAxis = getRangeAxisForDataset(datasetIndex);
3401        RectangleEdge yAxisEdge = getRangeAxisEdge();
3402        rangecrosshair_extract(g2, anchor, dataArea, crosshairState, yAxis, yAxisEdge);
3403
3404        // draw an outline around the plot area...
3405        is_outlinevisible_extract(g2, dataArea);
3406
3407    }
3408
3409        private void is_outlinevisible_extract(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D dataArea) {
3410                if (isOutlineVisible()) {
3411            if (getRenderer() != null) {
3412                getRenderer().drawOutline(g2, this, dataArea);
3413            }
3414            else {
3415                drawOutline(g2, dataArea);
3416            }
3417        }
3418        }
3419
3420        private void iteraterendererindexes_extract(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D dataArea, List<Integer> rendererIndices) {
3421                for (int i : rendererIndices) {
3422            drawDomainMarkers(g2, dataArea, i, Layer.FOREGROUND);
3423        }
3424        for (int i : rendererIndices) {
3425            drawRangeMarkers(g2, dataArea, i, Layer.FOREGROUND);
3426        }
3427        }
3428
3429        private void chechaxis_extract(Graphics2D g2, PlotState parentState, Rectangle2D dataArea,
3430                        AxisState rangeAxisState) {
3431                if (rangeAxisState == null) {
3432            if (parentState != null) {
3433                rangeAxisState = parentState.getSharedAxisStates()
3434                        .get(getRangeAxis());
3435            }
3436        }
3437        if (rangeAxisState != null) {
3438            drawRangeGridlines(g2, dataArea, rangeAxisState.getTicks());
3439            drawZeroRangeBaseline(g2, dataArea);
3440        }
3441        }
3442
3443        private void iterate_renderer_extract(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D dataArea) {
3444                for (CategoryItemRenderer renderer : this.renderers.values()) {
3445            int i = getIndexOf(renderer);
3446            drawDomainMarkers(g2, dataArea, i, Layer.BACKGROUND);
3447        }
3448        for (CategoryItemRenderer renderer : this.renderers.values()) {
3449            int i = getIndexOf(renderer);
3450            drawRangeMarkers(g2, dataArea, i, Layer.BACKGROUND);
3451        }
3452        }
3453
3454        private void rangecrosshair_extract(Graphics2D g2, Point2D anchor, Rectangle2D dataArea,
3455                        CategoryCrosshairState<R, C> crosshairState, ValueAxis yAxis, RectangleEdge yAxisEdge) {
3456                if (!this.rangeCrosshairLockedOnData && anchor != null) {
3457            double yy;
3458            if (getOrientation() == PlotOrientation.VERTICAL) {
3459                yy = yAxis.java2DToValue(anchor.getY(), dataArea, yAxisEdge);
3460            }
3461            else {
3462                yy = yAxis.java2DToValue(anchor.getX(), dataArea, yAxisEdge);
3463            }
3464            crosshairState.setCrosshairY(yy);
3465        }
3466        setRangeCrosshairValue(crosshairState.getCrosshairY(), false);
3467        if (isRangeCrosshairVisible()) {
3468            double y = getRangeCrosshairValue();
3469            Paint paint = getRangeCrosshairPaint();
3470            Stroke stroke = getRangeCrosshairStroke();
3471            drawRangeCrosshair(g2, dataArea, getOrientation(), y, yAxis,
3472                    stroke, paint);
3473        }
3474        }
3475
3476        private void anchor_extract(Point2D anchor, Rectangle2D dataArea, CategoryCrosshairState<R, C> crosshairState) {
3477                if (anchor != null) {
3478            ValueAxis rangeAxis = getRangeAxis();
3479            if (rangeAxis != null) {
3480                double y;
3481                if (getOrientation() == PlotOrientation.VERTICAL) {
3482                    y = rangeAxis.java2DToValue(anchor.getY(), dataArea,
3483                            getRangeAxisEdge());
3484                }
3485                else {
3486                    y = rangeAxis.java2DToValue(anchor.getX(), dataArea,
3487                            getRangeAxisEdge());
3488                }
3489                crosshairState.setAnchorY(y);
3490            }
3491        }
3492        }
3493
3494    /**
3495     * Returns the indices of the non-null datasets in the specified order.
3496     * 
3497     * @param order  the order ({@code null} not permitted).
3498     * 
3499     * @return The list of indices. 
3500     */
3501    private List<Integer> getDatasetIndices(DatasetRenderingOrder order) {
3502        List<Integer> result = new ArrayList<>();
3503        for (Map.Entry<Integer, CategoryDataset<R, C>> entry : 
3504                this.datasets.entrySet()) {
3505            if (entry.getValue() != null) {
3506                result.add(entry.getKey());
3507            }
3508        }
3509        Collections.sort(result);
3510        if (order == DatasetRenderingOrder.REVERSE) {
3511            Collections.reverse(result);
3512        }
3513        return result;
3514    }
3515    
3516    /**
3517     * Returns the indices of the non-null renderers for the plot, in the 
3518     * specified order.
3519     * 
3520     * @param order  the rendering order {@code null} not permitted).
3521     * 
3522     * @return A list of indices.
3523     */
3524    private List<Integer> getRendererIndices(DatasetRenderingOrder order) {
3525        List<Integer> result = new ArrayList<>();
3526        for (Map.Entry<Integer, CategoryItemRenderer> entry: 
3527                this.renderers.entrySet()) {
3528            if (entry.getValue() != null) {
3529                result.add(entry.getKey());
3530            }
3531        }
3532        Collections.sort(result);
3533        if (order == DatasetRenderingOrder.REVERSE) {
3534            Collections.reverse(result);
3535        }
3536        return result;        
3537    }
3538    
3539    /**
3540     * Draws the plot background (the background color and/or image).
3541     * <P>
3542     * This method will be called during the chart drawing process and is
3543     * declared public so that it can be accessed by the renderers used by
3544     * certain subclasses.  You shouldn't need to call this method directly.
3545     *
3546     * @param g2  the graphics device.
3547     * @param area  the area within which the plot should be drawn.
3548     */
3549    @Override
3550    public void drawBackground(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D area) {
3551        fillBackground(g2, area, this.orientation);
3552        drawBackgroundImage(g2, area);
3553    }
3554
3555    /**
3556     * A utility method for drawing the plot's axes.
3557     *
3558     * @param g2  the graphics device.
3559     * @param plotArea  the plot area.
3560     * @param dataArea  the data area.
3561     * @param plotState  collects information about the plot ({@code null}
3562     *                   permitted).
3563     *
3564     * @return A map containing the axis states.
3565     */
3566    protected Map<Axis, AxisState> drawAxes(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D plotArea, 
3567            Rectangle2D dataArea, PlotRenderingInfo plotState) {
3568
3569        AxisCollection axisCollection = new AxisCollection();
3570
3571        // add domain axes to lists...
3572        for (CategoryAxis xAxis : this.domainAxes.values()) {
3573            if (xAxis != null) {
3574                int index = getDomainAxisIndex(xAxis);
3575                axisCollection.add(xAxis, getDomainAxisEdge(index));
3576            }
3577        }
3578
3579        // add range axes to lists...
3580        for (ValueAxis yAxis : this.rangeAxes.values()) {
3581            if (yAxis != null) {
3582                int index = findRangeAxisIndex(yAxis);
3583                axisCollection.add(yAxis, getRangeAxisEdge(index));
3584            }
3585        }
3586
3587        Map<Axis, AxisState> axisStateMap = new HashMap<>();
3588
3589        // draw the top axes
3590        double cursor = dataArea.getMinY() - this.axisOffset.calculateTopOutset(
3591                dataArea.getHeight());
3592        for (Axis axis: axisCollection.getAxesAtTop()) {
3593            if (axis != null) {
3594                AxisState axisState = axis.draw(g2, cursor, plotArea, dataArea,
3595                        RectangleEdge.TOP, plotState);
3596                cursor = axisState.getCursor();
3597                axisStateMap.put(axis, axisState);
3598            }
3599        }
3600
3601        // draw the bottom axes
3602        cursor = dataArea.getMaxY()
3603                 + this.axisOffset.calculateBottomOutset(dataArea.getHeight());
3604        for (Axis axis : axisCollection.getAxesAtBottom()) {
3605            if (axis != null) {
3606                AxisState axisState = axis.draw(g2, cursor, plotArea, dataArea,
3607                        RectangleEdge.BOTTOM, plotState);
3608                cursor = axisState.getCursor();
3609                axisStateMap.put(axis, axisState);
3610            }
3611        }
3612
3613        // draw the left axes
3614        cursor = dataArea.getMinX()
3615                 - this.axisOffset.calculateLeftOutset(dataArea.getWidth());
3616        for (Axis axis : axisCollection.getAxesAtLeft()) {
3617            if (axis != null) {
3618                AxisState axisState = axis.draw(g2, cursor, plotArea, dataArea,
3619                        RectangleEdge.LEFT, plotState);
3620                cursor = axisState.getCursor();
3621                axisStateMap.put(axis, axisState);
3622            }
3623        }
3624
3625        // draw the right axes
3626        cursor = dataArea.getMaxX()
3627                 + this.axisOffset.calculateRightOutset(dataArea.getWidth());
3628        for (Axis axis: axisCollection.getAxesAtRight()) {
3629            if (axis != null) {
3630                AxisState axisState = axis.draw(g2, cursor, plotArea, dataArea,
3631                        RectangleEdge.RIGHT, plotState);
3632                cursor = axisState.getCursor();
3633                axisStateMap.put(axis, axisState);
3634            }
3635        }
3636        return axisStateMap;
3637    }
3638
3639    /**
3640     * Draws a representation of a dataset within the dataArea region using the
3641     * appropriate renderer.
3642     *
3643     * @param g2  the graphics device.
3644     * @param dataArea  the region in which the data is to be drawn.
3645     * @param index  the dataset and renderer index.
3646     * @param info  an optional object for collection dimension information.
3647     * @param crosshairState  a state object for tracking crosshair info
3648     *        ({@code null} permitted).
3649     *
3650     * @return A boolean that indicates whether or not real data was found.
3651     */
3652    public boolean render(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D dataArea, int index,
3653            PlotRenderingInfo info, CategoryCrosshairState<R, C> crosshairState) {
3654
3655        boolean foundData = false;
3656        CategoryDataset<R, C> currentDataset = getDataset(index);
3657        CategoryItemRenderer renderer = getRenderer(index);
3658        CategoryAxis domainAxis = getDomainAxisForDataset(index);
3659        ValueAxis rangeAxis = getRangeAxisForDataset(index);
3660        boolean hasData = !DatasetUtils.isEmptyOrNull(currentDataset);
3661        if (hasData && renderer != null) {
3662
3663            foundData = true;
3664            CategoryItemRendererState state = renderer.initialise(g2, dataArea,
3665                    this, index, info);
3666            state.setCrosshairState(crosshairState);
3667            int columnCount = currentDataset.getColumnCount();
3668            int rowCount = currentDataset.getRowCount();
3669            int passCount = renderer.getPassCount();
3670            for (int pass = 0; pass < passCount; pass++) {
3671                if (this.columnRenderingOrder == SortOrder.ASCENDING) {
3672                    for (int column = 0; column < columnCount; column++) {
3673                        if (this.rowRenderingOrder == SortOrder.ASCENDING) {
3674                            for (int row = 0; row < rowCount; row++) {
3675                                renderer.drawItem(g2, state, dataArea, this,
3676                                        domainAxis, rangeAxis, currentDataset,
3677                                        row, column, pass);
3678                            }
3679                        }
3680                        else {
3681                            for (int row = rowCount - 1; row >= 0; row--) {
3682                                renderer.drawItem(g2, state, dataArea, this,
3683                                        domainAxis, rangeAxis, currentDataset,
3684                                        row, column, pass);
3685                            }
3686                        }
3687                    }
3688                }
3689                else {
3690                    for (int column = columnCount - 1; column >= 0; column--) {
3691                        if (this.rowRenderingOrder == SortOrder.ASCENDING) {
3692                            for (int row = 0; row < rowCount; row++) {
3693                                renderer.drawItem(g2, state, dataArea, this,
3694                                        domainAxis, rangeAxis, currentDataset,
3695                                        row, column, pass);
3696                            }
3697                        }
3698                        else {
3699                            for (int row = rowCount - 1; row >= 0; row--) {
3700                                renderer.drawItem(g2, state, dataArea, this,
3701                                        domainAxis, rangeAxis, currentDataset,
3702                                        row, column, pass);
3703                            }
3704                        }
3705                    }
3706                }
3707            }
3708        }
3709        return foundData;
3710
3711    }
3712
3713    /**
3714     * Draws the domain gridlines for the plot, if they are visible.
3715     *
3716     * @param g2  the graphics device.
3717     * @param dataArea  the area inside the axes.
3718     *
3719     * @see #drawRangeGridlines(Graphics2D, Rectangle2D, List)
3720     */
3721    protected void drawDomainGridlines(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D dataArea) {
3722
3723        if (!isDomainGridlinesVisible()) {
3724            return;
3725        }
3726        CategoryAnchor anchor = getDomainGridlinePosition();
3727        RectangleEdge domainAxisEdge = getDomainAxisEdge();
3728        CategoryDataset<R, C> dataset = getDataset();
3729        if (dataset == null) {
3730            return;
3731        }
3732        CategoryAxis axis = getDomainAxis();
3733        if (axis != null) {
3734            int columnCount = dataset.getColumnCount();
3735            for (int c = 0; c < columnCount; c++) {
3736                double xx = axis.getCategoryJava2DCoordinate(anchor, c,
3737                        columnCount, dataArea, domainAxisEdge);
3738                CategoryItemRenderer renderer1 = getRenderer();
3739                if (renderer1 != null) {
3740                    renderer1.drawDomainGridline(g2, this, dataArea, xx);
3741                }
3742            }
3743        }
3744    }
3745
3746    /**
3747     * Draws the range gridlines for the plot, if they are visible.
3748     *
3749     * @param g2  the graphics device ({@code null} not permitted).
3750     * @param dataArea  the area inside the axes ({@code null} not permitted).
3751     * @param ticks  the ticks.
3752     *
3753     * @see #drawDomainGridlines(Graphics2D, Rectangle2D)
3754     */
3755    protected void drawRangeGridlines(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D dataArea,
3756                                      List<ValueTick> ticks) {
3757        // draw the range grid lines, if any...
3758        if (!isRangeGridlinesVisible() && !isRangeMinorGridlinesVisible()) {
3759            return;
3760        }
3761        // no axis, no gridlines...
3762        ValueAxis axis = getRangeAxis();
3763        if (axis == null) {
3764            return;
3765        }
3766        // no renderer, no gridlines...
3767        CategoryItemRenderer r = getRenderer();
3768        if (r == null) {
3769            return;
3770        }
3771
3772        Stroke gridStroke = null;
3773        Paint gridPaint = null;
3774        boolean paintLine;
3775        for (ValueTick tick : ticks) {
3776            paintLine = false;
3777            if ((tick.getTickType() == TickType.MINOR)
3778                    && isRangeMinorGridlinesVisible()) {
3779                gridStroke = getRangeMinorGridlineStroke();
3780                gridPaint = getRangeMinorGridlinePaint();
3781                paintLine = true;
3782            }
3783            else if ((tick.getTickType() == TickType.MAJOR)
3784                    && isRangeGridlinesVisible()) {
3785                gridStroke = getRangeGridlineStroke();
3786                gridPaint = getRangeGridlinePaint();
3787                paintLine = true;
3788            }
3789            if (((tick.getValue() != 0.0)
3790                    || !isRangeZeroBaselineVisible()) && paintLine) {
3791                r .drawRangeLine(g2, this, axis, dataArea,
3792                            tick.getValue(), gridPaint, gridStroke);
3793            }
3794        }
3795    }
3796
3797    /**
3798     * Draws a base line across the chart at value zero on the range axis.
3799     *
3800     * @param g2  the graphics device.
3801     * @param area  the data area.
3802     *
3803     * @see #setRangeZeroBaselineVisible(boolean)
3804     */
3805    protected void drawZeroRangeBaseline(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D area) {
3806        if (!isRangeZeroBaselineVisible()) {
3807            return;
3808        }
3809        CategoryItemRenderer r = getRenderer();
3810        r.drawRangeLine(g2, this, getRangeAxis(), area, 0.0,
3811                    this.rangeZeroBaselinePaint, this.rangeZeroBaselineStroke);
3812    }

3814    /**
3815     * Draws the annotations.
3816     *
3817     * @param g2  the graphics device.
3818     * @param dataArea  the data area.
3819     */
3820    protected void drawAnnotations(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D dataArea) {
3821        if (getAnnotations() != null) {
3822            for (CategoryAnnotation annotation : getAnnotations()) {
3823                annotation.draw(g2, this, dataArea, getDomainAxis(),
3824                        getRangeAxis());
3825            }
3826        }
3827    }

3829    /**
3830     * Draws the domain markers (if any) for an axis and layer.  This method is
3831     * typically called from within the draw() method.
3832     *
3833     * @param g2  the graphics device.
3834     * @param dataArea  the data area.
3835     * @param index  the renderer index.
3836     * @param layer  the layer (foreground or background).
3837     *
3838     * @see #drawRangeMarkers(Graphics2D, Rectangle2D, int, Layer)
3839     */
3840    protected void drawDomainMarkers(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D dataArea,
3841                                     int index, Layer layer) {
3842
3843        CategoryItemRenderer r = getRenderer(index);
3844        if (r == null) {
3845            return;
3846        }
3847
3848        Collection<CategoryMarker> markers = getDomainMarkers(index, layer);
3849        CategoryAxis axis = getDomainAxisForDataset(index);
3850        if (markers != null && axis != null) {
3851            for (CategoryMarker marker : markers) {
3852                r.drawDomainMarker(g2, this, axis, marker, dataArea);
3853            }
3854        }
3855
3856    }
3857
3858    /**
3859     * Draws the range markers (if any) for an axis and layer.  This method is
3860     * typically called from within the draw() method.
3861     *
3862     * @param g2  the graphics device.
3863     * @param dataArea  the data area.
3864     * @param index  the renderer index.
3865     * @param layer  the layer (foreground or background).
3866     *
3867     * @see #drawDomainMarkers(Graphics2D, Rectangle2D, int, Layer)
3868     */
3869    protected void drawRangeMarkers(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D dataArea,
3870            int index, Layer layer) {
3871
3872        CategoryItemRenderer r = getRenderer(index);
3873        if (r == null) {
3874            return;
3875        }
3876
3877        Collection<Marker> markers = getRangeMarkers(index, layer);
3878        ValueAxis axis = getRangeAxisForDataset(index);
3879        if (markers != null && axis != null) {
3880            for (Marker marker : markers) {
3881                r.drawRangeMarker(g2, this, axis, marker, dataArea);
3882            }
3883        }
3884
3885    }
3886
3887    /**
3888     * Utility method for drawing a line perpendicular to the range axis (used
3889     * for crosshairs).
3890     *
3891     * @param g2  the graphics device.
3892     * @param dataArea  the area defined by the axes.
3893     * @param value  the data value.
3894     * @param stroke  the line stroke ({@code null} not permitted).
3895     * @param paint  the line paint ({@code null} not permitted).
3896     */
3897    protected void drawRangeLine(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D dataArea,
3898            double value, Stroke stroke, Paint paint) {
3899
3900        double java2D = getRangeAxis().valueToJava2D(value, dataArea,
3901                getRangeAxisEdge());
3902        Line2D line = null;
3903        if (this.orientation == PlotOrientation.HORIZONTAL) {
3904            line = new Line2D.Double(java2D, dataArea.getMinY(), java2D,
3905                    dataArea.getMaxY());
3906        }
3907        else if (this.orientation == PlotOrientation.VERTICAL) {
3908            line = new Line2D.Double(dataArea.getMinX(), java2D,
3909                    dataArea.getMaxX(), java2D);
3910        }
3911        g2.setStroke(stroke);
3912        g2.setPaint(paint);
3913        g2.draw(line);
3914
3915    }
3916
3917    /**
3918     * Draws a domain crosshair.
3919     *
3920     * @param g2  the graphics target.
3921     * @param dataArea  the data area.
3922     * @param orientation  the plot orientation.
3923     * @param datasetIndex  the dataset index.
3924     * @param rowKey  the row key.
3925     * @param columnKey  the column key.
3926     * @param stroke  the stroke used to draw the crosshair line.
3927     * @param paint  the paint used to draw the crosshair line.
3928     *
3929     * @see #drawRangeCrosshair(Graphics2D, Rectangle2D, PlotOrientation,
3930     *     double, ValueAxis, Stroke, Paint)
3931     */
3932    protected void drawDomainCrosshair(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D dataArea,
3933            PlotOrientation orientation, int datasetIndex, R rowKey, C columnKey,
3934            Stroke stroke, Paint paint) {
3935        CategoryDataset<R, C> dataset = getDataset(datasetIndex);
3936        CategoryAxis axis = getDomainAxisForDataset(datasetIndex);
3937        CategoryItemRenderer renderer = getRenderer(datasetIndex);
3938        Line2D line;
3939        if (orientation == PlotOrientation.VERTICAL) {
3940            double xx = renderer.getItemMiddle(rowKey, columnKey, dataset, axis,
3941                    dataArea, RectangleEdge.BOTTOM);
3942            line = new Line2D.Double(xx, dataArea.getMinY(), xx,
3943                    dataArea.getMaxY());
3944        }
3945        else {
3946            double yy = renderer.getItemMiddle(rowKey, columnKey, dataset, axis,
3947                    dataArea, RectangleEdge.LEFT);
3948            line = new Line2D.Double(dataArea.getMinX(), yy,
3949                    dataArea.getMaxX(), yy);
3950        }
3951        g2.setStroke(stroke);
3952        g2.setPaint(paint);
3953        g2.draw(line);
3954
3955    }
3956
3957    /**
3958     * Draws a range crosshair.
3959     *
3960     * @param g2  the graphics target.
3961     * @param dataArea  the data area.
3962     * @param orientation  the plot orientation.
3963     * @param value  the crosshair value.
3964     * @param axis  the axis against which the value is measured.
3965     * @param stroke  the stroke used to draw the crosshair line.
3966     * @param paint  the paint used to draw the crosshair line.
3967     *
3968     * @see #drawDomainCrosshair(Graphics2D, Rectangle2D, PlotOrientation, int,
3969     *      Comparable, Comparable, Stroke, Paint)
3970     */
3971    protected void drawRangeCrosshair(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D dataArea,
3972            PlotOrientation orientation, double value, ValueAxis axis,
3973            Stroke stroke, Paint paint) {
3974
3975        if (!axis.getRange().contains(value)) {
3976            return;
3977        }
3978        Line2D line;
3979        if (orientation == PlotOrientation.HORIZONTAL) {
3980            double xx = axis.valueToJava2D(value, dataArea,
3981                    RectangleEdge.BOTTOM);
3982            line = new Line2D.Double(xx, dataArea.getMinY(), xx,
3983                    dataArea.getMaxY());
3984        }
3985        else {
3986            double yy = axis.valueToJava2D(value, dataArea,
3987                    RectangleEdge.LEFT);
3988            line = new Line2D.Double(dataArea.getMinX(), yy,
3989                    dataArea.getMaxX(), yy);
3990        }
3991        g2.setStroke(stroke);
3992        g2.setPaint(paint);
3993        g2.draw(line);
3994
3995    }
3996
3997    /**
3998     * Returns the range of data values that will be plotted against the range
3999     * axis.  If the dataset is {@code null}, this method returns
4000     * {@code null}.
4001     *
4002     * @param axis  the axis.
4003     *
4004     * @return The data range.
4005     */
4006    @Override
4007    public Range getDataRange(ValueAxis axis) {
4008        Range result = null;
4009        List<CategoryDataset<R, C>> mappedDatasets = new ArrayList<>();
4010        int rangeIndex = findRangeAxisIndex(axis);
4011        if (rangeIndex >= 0) {
4012            mappedDatasets.addAll(datasetsMappedToRangeAxis(rangeIndex));
4013        }
4014        else if (axis == getRangeAxis()) {
4015            mappedDatasets.addAll(datasetsMappedToRangeAxis(0));
4016        }
4017
4018        // iterate through the datasets that map to the axis and get the union
4019        // of the ranges.
4020        for (CategoryDataset<R, C> d : mappedDatasets) {
4021            CategoryItemRenderer r = getRendererForDataset(d);
4022            if (r != null) {
4023                result = Range.combine(result, r.findRangeBounds(d));
4024            }
4025        }
4026        return result;
4027    }
4028
4029    /**
4030     * Returns a list of the datasets that are mapped to the axis with the
4031     * specified index.
4032     *
4033     * @param axisIndex  the axis index.
4034     *
4035     * @return The list (possibly empty, but never {@code null}).
4036     */
4037    private List<CategoryDataset<R, C>> datasetsMappedToDomainAxis(int axisIndex) {
4038        List<CategoryDataset<R, C>> result = new ArrayList<>();
4039        for (Entry<Integer, CategoryDataset<R, C>> entry : this.datasets.entrySet()) {
4040            CategoryDataset<R, C> dataset = entry.getValue();
4041            if (dataset == null) {
4042                continue;
4043            }
4044            Integer datasetIndex = entry.getKey();
4045            List<Integer> mappedAxes = this.datasetToDomainAxesMap.get(datasetIndex);
4046            if (mappedAxes == null) {
4047                if (axisIndex == 0) {
4048                    result.add(dataset);
4049                }
4050            } else {
4051                if (mappedAxes.contains(axisIndex)) {
4052                    result.add(dataset);
4053                }
4054            }
4055        }
4056        return result;
4057    }
4058
4059    /**
4060     * A utility method that returns a list of datasets that are mapped to a
4061     * given range axis.
4062     *
4063     * @param axisIndex  the axis index.
4064     *
4065     * @return The list (possibly empty, but never {@code null}).
4066     */
4067    private List<CategoryDataset<R, C>> datasetsMappedToRangeAxis(int axisIndex) {
4068        List<CategoryDataset<R, C>> result = new ArrayList<>();
4069        for (Entry<Integer, CategoryDataset<R, C>> entry : this.datasets.entrySet()) {
4070            Integer datasetIndex = entry.getKey();
4071            CategoryDataset<R, C> dataset = entry.getValue();
4072            List<Integer> mappedAxes = this.datasetToRangeAxesMap.get(
4073                    datasetIndex);
4074            if (mappedAxes == null) {
4075                if (axisIndex == 0) {
4076                    result.add(dataset);
4077                }
4078            } else {
4079                if (mappedAxes.contains(axisIndex)) {
4080                    result.add(dataset);
4081                }
4082            }
4083        }
4084        return result;
4085    }

4174    /**
4175     * Sets the fixed range axis space and sends a {@link PlotChangeEvent} to
4176     * all registered listeners.
4177     *
4178     * @param space  the space ({@code null} permitted).
4179     * @param notify  notify listeners?
4180     *
4181     * @see #getFixedRangeAxisSpace()
4182     */
4183    public void setFixedRangeAxisSpace(AxisSpace space, boolean notify) {
4184        this.fixedRangeAxisSpace = space;
4185        if (notify) {
4186            fireChangeEvent();
4187        }
4188    }
4189
4190    /**
4191     * Returns a list of the categories in the plot's primary dataset.
4192     *
4193     * @return A list of the categories in the plot's primary dataset.
4194     *
4195     * @see #getCategoriesForAxis(CategoryAxis)
4196     */
4197    public List<C> getCategories() {
4198        List<C> result = null;
4199        if (getDataset() != null) {
4200            result = Collections.unmodifiableList(getDataset().getColumnKeys());
4201        }
4202        return result;
4203    }
4204
4205    /**
4206     * Returns a list of the categories that should be displayed for the
4207     * specified axis.
4208     *
4209     * @param axis  the axis ({@code null} not permitted)
4210     *
4211     * @return The categories.
4212     */
4213    public List<C> getCategoriesForAxis(CategoryAxis axis) {
4214        List<C> result = new ArrayList<>();
4215        int axisIndex = getDomainAxisIndex(axis);
4216        for (CategoryDataset<R, C> dataset : datasetsMappedToDomainAxis(axisIndex)) {
4217            // add the unique categories from this dataset
4218            for (int i = 0; i < dataset.getColumnCount(); i++) {
4219                C category = dataset.getColumnKey(i);
4220                if (!result.contains(category)) {
4221                    result.add(category);
4222                }
4223            }
4224        }
4225        return result;
4226    }

4281     * Sets the flag that enables or disables panning of the plot along

4283     *
4284     * @param pannable  the new flag value.
4285     *

4292    /**
4293     * Pans the domain axes by the specified percentage.
4294     *
4295     * @param percent  the distance to pan (as a percentage of the axis length).
4296     * @param info the plot info
4297     * @param source the source point where the pan action started.
4298     */
4299    @Override
4300    public void panDomainAxes(double percent, PlotRenderingInfo info,
4301            Point2D source) {
4302        // do nothing, because the plot is not pannable along the domain axes
4303    }
4304
4305    /**
4306     * Pans the range axes by the specified percentage.
4307     *
4308     * @param percent  the distance to pan (as a percentage of the axis length).
4309     * @param info the plot info
4310     * @param source the source point where the pan action started.
4311     */
4312    @Override
4313    public void panRangeAxes(double percent, PlotRenderingInfo info,
4314            Point2D source) {
4315        if (!isRangePannable()) {
4316            return;
4317        }
4318        for (ValueAxis axis : this.rangeAxes.values()) {
4319            if (axis == null) {
4320                continue;
4321            }
4322            double length = axis.getRange().getLength();
4323            double adj = percent * length;
4324            if (axis.isInverted()) {
4325                adj = -adj;
4326            }
4327            axis.setRange(axis.getLowerBound() + adj,
4328                    axis.getUpperBound() + adj);
4329        }
4330    }

4386    /**
4387     * This method does nothing, because {@code CategoryPlot} doesn't
4388     * support zooming on the domain.
4389     *
4390     * @param factor  the zoom factor.
4391     * @param info  the plot rendering info.
4392     * @param source  the source point (in Java2D space).
4393     * @param useAnchor  use source point as zoom anchor?
4394     *
4395     * @see #zoomRangeAxes(double, PlotRenderingInfo, Point2D, boolean)
4396     */
4397    @Override
4398    public void zoomDomainAxes(double factor, PlotRenderingInfo info,
4399                               Point2D source, boolean useAnchor) {
4400        // can't zoom domain axis
4401    }
4402
4403    /**
4404     * Multiplies the range on the range axis/axes by the specified factor.
4405     *
4406     * @param factor  the zoom factor.
4407     * @param state  the plot state.
4408     * @param source  the source point (in Java2D space) for the zoom.
4409     */
4410    @Override
4411    public void zoomRangeAxes(double factor, PlotRenderingInfo state,
4412                              Point2D source) {
4413        // delegate to other method
4414        zoomRangeAxes(factor, state, source, false);
4415    }
4416
4417    /**
4418     * Multiplies the range on the range axis/axes by the specified factor.
4419     *
4420     * @param factor  the zoom factor.
4421     * @param info  the plot rendering info.
4422     * @param source  the source point.
4423     * @param useAnchor  a flag that controls whether or not the source point
4424     *         is used for the zoom anchor.
4425     *
4426     * @see #zoomDomainAxes(double, PlotRenderingInfo, Point2D, boolean)
4427     */
4428    @Override
4429    public void zoomRangeAxes(double factor, PlotRenderingInfo info,
4430                              Point2D source, boolean useAnchor) {
4431
4432        // perform the zoom on each range axis
4433        for (ValueAxis rangeAxis : this.rangeAxes.values()) {
4434            if (rangeAxis == null) {
4435                continue;
4436            }
4437            if (useAnchor) {
4438                // get the relevant source coordinate given the plot orientation
4439                double sourceY = source.getY();
4440                if (this.orientation.isHorizontal()) {
4441                    sourceY = source.getX();
4442                }
4443                double anchorY = rangeAxis.java2DToValue(sourceY,
4444                        info.getDataArea(), getRangeAxisEdge());
4445                rangeAxis.resizeRange2(factor, anchorY);
4446            } else {
4447                rangeAxis.resizeRange(factor);
4448            }
4449        }
4450    }
4451
4452    /**
4453     * Zooms in on the range axes.
4454     *
4455     * @param lowerPercent  the lower bound.
4456     * @param upperPercent  the upper bound.
4457     * @param state  the plot state.
4458     * @param source  the source point (in Java2D space) for the zoom.
4459     */
4460    @Override
4461    public void zoomRangeAxes(double lowerPercent, double upperPercent,
4462            PlotRenderingInfo state, Point2D source) {
4463        for (ValueAxis yAxis : this.rangeAxes.values()) {
4464            if (yAxis != null) {
4465                yAxis.zoomRange(lowerPercent, upperPercent);
4466            }
4467        }
4468    }

4513     *
4514     * @return A boolean.
4515     */
4516    @Override
4517    public boolean equals(Object obj) {
4518        if (obj == this) {
4519            return true;
4520        }
4521        if (!(obj instanceof CategoryPlot)) {
4522            return false;
4523        }               
4524        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")

4530            return false;
4531        }

4534        }

4539            return false;

4551            return false;

4554            return false;

4557            return false;

4780
4781    /**
4782     * Returns a clone of the plot.
4783     *
4784     * @return A clone.
4785     *
4786     * @throws CloneNotSupportedException  if the cloning is not supported.
4787     */
4788    @Override
4789    public Object clone() throws CloneNotSupportedException {
4790        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
4791        CategoryPlot<R, C> clone = (CategoryPlot) super.clone();
4792        clone.domainAxes = CloneUtils.cloneMapValues(this.domainAxes);
4793        for (CategoryAxis axis : clone.domainAxes.values()) {
4794            if (axis != null) {
4795                axis.setPlot(clone);
4796                axis.addChangeListener(clone);
4797            }
4798        }
4799        clone.rangeAxes = CloneUtils.cloneMapValues(this.rangeAxes);
4800        for (ValueAxis axis : clone.rangeAxes.values()) {
4801            if (axis != null) {
4802                axis.setPlot(clone);
4803                axis.addChangeListener(clone);
4804            }
4805        }
4806
4807        // AxisLocation is immutable, so we can just copy the maps
4808        clone.domainAxisLocations = new HashMap<>(
4809                this.domainAxisLocations);
4810        clone.rangeAxisLocations = new HashMap<>(
4811                this.rangeAxisLocations);
4812
4813        clone.datasets = new HashMap<>(this.datasets);
4814        for (CategoryDataset<R, C> dataset : clone.datasets.values()) {
4815            if (dataset != null) {
4816                dataset.addChangeListener(clone);
4817            }
4818        }
4819        clone.datasetToDomainAxesMap = new TreeMap<>();
4820        clone.datasetToDomainAxesMap.putAll(this.datasetToDomainAxesMap);
4821        clone.datasetToRangeAxesMap = new TreeMap<>();
4822        clone.datasetToRangeAxesMap.putAll(this.datasetToRangeAxesMap);
4823
4824        clone.renderers = CloneUtils.cloneMapValues(this.renderers);
4825        for (CategoryItemRenderer renderer : clone.renderers.values()) {
4826            if (renderer != null) {
4827                renderer.setPlot(clone);
4828                renderer.addChangeListener(clone);
4829            }
4830        }
4831        if (this.fixedDomainAxisSpace != null) {
4832            clone.fixedDomainAxisSpace = CloneUtils.clone(
4833                    this.fixedDomainAxisSpace);
4834        }
4835        if (this.fixedRangeAxisSpace != null) {
4836            clone.fixedRangeAxisSpace = CloneUtils.clone(
4837                    this.fixedRangeAxisSpace);
4838        }
4839
4840        clone.annotations = CloneUtils.cloneList(this.annotations);
4841        clone.foregroundDomainMarkers = CloneUtils.cloneMapValues(
4842                this.foregroundDomainMarkers);
4843        clone.backgroundDomainMarkers = CloneUtils.cloneMapValues(
4844                this.backgroundDomainMarkers);
4845        clone.foregroundRangeMarkers = CloneUtils.cloneMapValues(
4846                this.foregroundRangeMarkers);
4847        clone.backgroundRangeMarkers = CloneUtils.cloneMapValues(
4848                this.backgroundRangeMarkers);
4849        if (this.fixedLegendItems != null) {
4850            clone.fixedLegendItems = CloneUtils.clone(this.fixedLegendItems);
4851        }
4852        return clone;
4853    }
4854
4855    /**
4856     * Provides serialization support.
4857     *
4858     * @param stream  the output stream.
4859     *
4860     * @throws IOException  if there is an I/O error.
4861     */
4862    private void writeObject(ObjectOutputStream stream) throws IOException {
4863        stream.defaultWriteObject();
4864        SerialUtils.writeStroke(this.domainGridlineStroke, stream);
4865        SerialUtils.writePaint(this.domainGridlinePaint, stream);
4866        SerialUtils.writeStroke(this.rangeGridlineStroke, stream);
4867        SerialUtils.writePaint(this.rangeGridlinePaint, stream);
4868        SerialUtils.writeStroke(this.rangeCrosshairStroke, stream);
4869        SerialUtils.writePaint(this.rangeCrosshairPaint, stream);
4870        SerialUtils.writeStroke(this.domainCrosshairStroke, stream);
4871        SerialUtils.writePaint(this.domainCrosshairPaint, stream);
4872        SerialUtils.writeStroke(this.rangeMinorGridlineStroke, stream);
4873        SerialUtils.writePaint(this.rangeMinorGridlinePaint, stream);
4874        SerialUtils.writeStroke(this.rangeZeroBaselineStroke, stream);
4875        SerialUtils.writePaint(this.rangeZeroBaselinePaint, stream);
4876    }
4877
4878    /**
4879     * Provides serialization support.
4880     *
4881     * @param stream  the input stream.
4882     *
4883     * @throws IOException  if there is an I/O error.
4884     * @throws ClassNotFoundException  if there is a classpath problem.
4885     */
4886    private void readObject(ObjectInputStream stream)
4887        throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException {
4888
4889        stream.defaultReadObject();
4890        this.domainGridlineStroke = SerialUtils.readStroke(stream);
4891        this.domainGridlinePaint = SerialUtils.readPaint(stream);
4892        this.rangeGridlineStroke = SerialUtils.readStroke(stream);
4893        this.rangeGridlinePaint = SerialUtils.readPaint(stream);
4894        this.rangeCrosshairStroke = SerialUtils.readStroke(stream);
4895        this.rangeCrosshairPaint = SerialUtils.readPaint(stream);
4896        this.domainCrosshairStroke = SerialUtils.readStroke(stream);
4897        this.domainCrosshairPaint = SerialUtils.readPaint(stream);
4898        this.rangeMinorGridlineStroke = SerialUtils.readStroke(stream);
4899        this.rangeMinorGridlinePaint = SerialUtils.readPaint(stream);
4900        this.rangeZeroBaselineStroke = SerialUtils.readStroke(stream);
4901        this.rangeZeroBaselinePaint = SerialUtils.readPaint(stream);
4902
4903        for (CategoryAxis xAxis : this.domainAxes.values()) {
4904            if (xAxis != null) {
4905                xAxis.setPlot(this);
4906                xAxis.addChangeListener(this);
4907            }
4908        }
4909        for (ValueAxis yAxis : this.rangeAxes.values()) {
4910            if (yAxis != null) {
4911                yAxis.setPlot(this);
4912                yAxis.addChangeListener(this);
4913            }
4914        }
4915        for (CategoryDataset<R, C> dataset : this.datasets.values()) {
4916            if (dataset != null) {
4917                dataset.addChangeListener(this);
4918            }
4919        }
4920        for (CategoryItemRenderer renderer : this.renderers.values()) {
4921            if (renderer != null) {
4922                renderer.addChangeListener(this);
4923            }
4924        }
4925
4926    }
